topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack(R) Carrier Grade (Beta): Disabling and Enabling Users

body.p: Users can be disabled in the domain. After you disable a user, the user account remains in the domain, but cannot be used to log in.
As an admin, you can disable and enable users, as needed.

li.p: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack(R) Horizon Dashboard.
Click the Identity dashboard, then the Users link.
In the Users screen, for the user you want to disable, click the arrow icon in the Actions menu and select Disable User.
The user is disabled and cannot be used to log in.
Launch the HP Helion OpenStack(R) Horizon Dashboard.
Click the Identity dashboard, then the Users link.
In the Users **screen, for the user you want to enable, click the arrow icon in the **Actions menu and select Enable User.
The user is enabled and can be used to log in.
